sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
What is the rank of the matrix below?

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$$

Show and explain the steps you took to determine the rank of the matrix.
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to bring the matrix to its row-echelon form. The rank of the matrix is the number of non-zero rows in its row-echelon form.

Given matrix:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$$

Step 1: Subtract 4 times the first row from the second row:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -3 & -6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$$

Step 2: Subtract 7 times the first row from the third row:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -3 & -6 \\ 0 & -6 & -12 \end{bmatrix}$$

Step 3: Divide the second row by -3:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & -6 & -12 \end{bmatrix}$$

Step 4: Add 6 times the second row to the third row:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$$

Now, the matrix is in row-echelon form. We can see that there are two non-zero rows, so the rank of the matrix is 2.
